abstruse.definition: Difficult to understand; obscure or profound.

cacophony.definition: A harsh, discordant mixture of sounds.

ephemeral.definition: Lasting for a very short time; transitory.

fastidious.definition: Very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail.

garrulous.definition: Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.

heterogeneous.definition: Diverse in character or content; composed of diverse parts or elements.

idiosyncratic.definition: Peculiar or unique to an individual.

juxtapose.definition: To place or deal with close together for contrasting effect.

mellifluous.definition: Sweet or musical; pleasant to hear.

obfuscate.definition: To render obscure, unclear, or unintelligible.

paradigm.definition: A typical example or pattern of something; a model.

quintessential.definition: Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.

recalcitrant.definition: Having an obstinately uncooperative attitude toward authority or discipline.

surreptitious.definition: Kept secret, especially because it would not be approved of.

taciturn.definition: Reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little.

vicissitude.definition: A change of circumstances or fortune, typically one that is unwelcome or unpleasant.

xenophobia.definition: Dislike of or prejudice against people from other countries.

aberration.definition: A departure from what is normal, usual, or expected, typically an unwelcome one.

bloviate.definition: To talk at length, especially in an inflated or empty way.

circumlocution.definition: The use of many words where fewer would do, especially in a deliberate attempt to be vague or evasive.

fecund.definition: Producing or capable of producing an abundance of offspring or new growth; fertile.

kowtow.definition: To act in an excessively subservient manner.

loquacious.definition: Tending to talk a great deal; talkative.

malfeasance.definition: Wrongdoing, especially by a public official.

nebulous.definition: In the form of a cloud or haze; hazy.

obsequious.definition: Obedient or attentive to an excessive or servile degree.

panacea.definition: A solution or remedy for all difficulties or diseases.

reticent.definition: Not revealing one's thoughts or feelings readily.

sycophant.definition: A person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage.

trepidation.definition: A feeling of fear or agitation about something that may happen.

vacillate.definition: To waver between different opinions or actions; be indecisive.

wanton.definition: Deliberate and unprovoked; sexually immodest or promiscuous.

xeric.definition: Characterized by, relating to, or requiring only a small amount of moisture.

yoke.definition: A wooden crosspiece that is fastened over the necks of two animals and attached to the plow or cart that they are to pull.

acerbic.definition: Sharp and forthright in manner or expression; harsh or severe.

bellicose.definition: Demonstrating aggression and willingness to fight.

capricious.definition: Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior.

dearth.definition: A scarcity or lack of something.

effervescent.definition: Vivacious and enthusiastic; giving off bubbles; fizzy.

facetious.definition: Treating serious issues with deliberately inappropriate humor; flippant.

grandiloquent.definition: Pompous or extravagant in language, style, or manner, especially in a way that is intended to impress.

hegemony.definition: Leadership or dominance, especially by one country or social group over others.

iconoclast.definition: A person who attacks or criticizes cherished beliefs or institutions.

jeopardize.definition: Put (someone or something) into a situation in which there is a danger of loss, harm, or failure.

kinetic.definition: Relating to or resulting from motion.

lugubrious.definition: Looking or sounding sad and dismal.

nonchalant.definition: Feeling or appearing casually calm and relaxed; not displaying anxiety, interest, or enthusiasm.

ostentatious.definition: Characterized by vulgar or pretentious display; designed to impress or attract notice.

quotidian.definition: Of or occurring every day; ordinary or everyday.

truculent.definition: Eager or quick to argue or fight; aggressively defiant.
